item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Monday, October 14, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Stallman Report (76 points | 63 comments)
2. Boring Tech Is Stifling Improvement (13 points | 24 comments)
3. What are you doing this week? (18 points | 24 comments)
4. OpenD on iPhone/Mac/etc.: ldc gets extern(Objective-C), dmd gets pragma(linkerDirective) and @section (6 points | 1 comment)
5. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (15 points | 5 comments)
6. Trust Rules Everything Around Me (WordPress, Code Security, etc.) (16 points | no comments)
7. vortex: A toolkit for working with compressed Arrow in-memory, on-disk, and over-the-wire. "The LLVM of file formats" (8 points | no comments)
8. Ubuntu Will Include The Latest Linux Kernel Version in Future Releases (16 points | 33 comments)
9. The Tragedy of the Common Lisp: Why Large Languages Explode (2015) (12 points | 3 comments)
10. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (23 points | 7 comments)
11. Python client for the $20 Colmi R02 smart ring (19 points | 3 comments)
12. Text-overflow: Ellipsis Considered Harmful (2022) (5 points | 2 comments)
13. A popular but wrong way to convert a string to uppercase or lowercase (13 points | 17 comments)
14. Minetest Rebranding to Luanti (9 points | 1 comment)
15. Deriving the Kelly Criterion to maximise Profits (4 points | no comments)
16. Zero-latency SQLite storage in every Durable Object (31 points | 9 comments)
17. FFmpeg Explorer (2023) (7 points | 1 comment)
18. Building the hundred-year web service with htmx (14 points | 1 comment)
19. EYG a predictable, and useful, programming language at func prog sweden (6 points | 3 comments)
20. Self-referential variable initialization in C (24 points | 13 comments)
21. Moving to LLVM IR (1 points | no comments)
22. The Uncertain Art of Accelerating ML Models (1 points | no comments)
23. Simply Logical: Intelligent Reasoning by Example (3 points | no comments)
24. You Could Have Invented Normalization-by-Evaluation (3 points | no comments)
25. fjall: LSM-based embeddable key-value storage engine written in safe Rust (3 points | no comments)
